intro: Carya ovata var. australis, commonly known as the Australian hickory, is a variant of the pecan species native to Australia. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, featuring a broad, rounded crown and smooth, gray bark. The leaves are alternate, simple, and have a serrated margin, typically measuring 10–20 cm in length. Its fruit is a drupe with a hard, woody shell enclosing a single edible nut. The plant is valued for its hardy nature and is often used in horticulture and as a shade tree.
